isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Flywheel and Flywheel Housing - Removal

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, disconnect ground (-) cable from battery before doing service or diagnostic procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device to support the transmission assembly during removal and installation.
To prevent personal injury or death, support engine (if in chassis) before removing any engine mounting bracket or flywheel housing bolts.
To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Disconnect the negative (ground) cable from the battery.
Disconnect the electrical cable and wires from the starter motor.
Remove bolts holding the starter motor to the flywheel housing and remove the starter.
Remove the transmission and clutch assembly. (See transmission manufacturers service publications.)

calloutgroup.callout1: M12 x 40 rear engine mount bolt (8)

note.para: There are two flywheel options for manual transmissions: 138-tooth ring gear and 148-tooth ring gear. For 148-tooth flywheels, loosen the two lowest, rear most M12 x 40 rear engine mount bolts to provide clearance for flywheel removal.

step1.para: Remove two M12 x 40 flywheel bolts, 180° from each other.
Install two guide pins (made locally) in place of the two flywheel bolts.
Remove remaining ten M12 x 40 flywheel bolts.
Carefully slide flywheel out of flywheel housing and off guide pins.
